body.name: AN AURA OF MYSTERY a gripping crime thriller with a huge twist (Ellie McEwan Mysteries Book 1)
body.description: The newly discovered novel from multi-million-selling author Joy Ellis. Never-before published!Flower shop owner Ellie McEwan is driving home late one frosty November night when a shadowy figure leaps into the road out of nowhere. Ellie swerves to avoid him — and slams head-on into the crash barrier.Days later, Ellie wakes up in hospital — and notices there’s something different. Everyone she looks at — the doctor, the nurse, her friend Carole — is surrounded by a coloured aura. Her near-death experience seems to have given her a new ability.And now Ellie must use her new-found gift to catch a killer.The battered body of a young woman is found in the grounds of a local hotel. She’s the third woman to be murdered in this sleepy Surrey village, her hands crushed and mutilated. Just like the other two.Each of the women was a skilled professional — a musician, a doctor and an artist. Apart from that, they appear to have nothing in common.And now the police’s one lead — a key witness — is missing.Although sceptical, a desperate DCI Bob Foreman calls on Ellie for help. But Ellie’s involvement in the investigation will throw her into the path of a brutal killer . . .DISCOVER A TOTALLY ENTHRALLING MYSTERY.This utterly gripping crime thriller is perfect for fans of L.J. Ross, J.D. Kirk, Elly Griffiths, Susan Hill, Kate Ellis or Ann Cleeves.READERS LOVE JOY ELLIS:⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘A great read.’ Terri H.⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘Simply the best.’ Booklover Bev⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐ ‘Wow! reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 26, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A bit different
reviews.reviewText: In her first, previously unpublished book, Ellis takes us into the realm of the possible, though maybe not probable world of someone who sees and learns to interpret auras. These auras are emitted by every living thing in an array of colors and reflect much about mood, health and state of mind. In addition, she introduces a character, recently dead, who appears as a friendly and helpful "ghost". With this as the premise, she spins a tale both interesting and entertaining. The prose is beautiful, the plot well constructed and the characters full and rich--like the books in her several series. What she has learned since this first book is focus and streamlining. This first novel has many characters and action that is wide ranging making the book longer and more diffuse than it really needs to be to tell the story. A few subplots could have been omitted with no harm done to the overall book. It leaves this book as a long, slow read without the sense of urgency one more often finds in a mystery. It is still enjoyable, however, and an entertaining peek at Ellis' origins as a writer. I look forward to the sequel and more about the lovely aura reader and her friends.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I love Joy Ellis' books. Why did she keep this in the drawer so long?Ellie, the dogs, Carole and are treasures! What an amazing story! Sometimes it seemed a bit disjointed as new characters and story lines were brought in. But the descriptions, dialogue, plot, character development and suspense were superb. Can't wait for the next volume. What an incredible gift Ellie has. Great read!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 17, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars An excellent mystery with a little spirit thrown in
reviews.reviewText: I generally avoid reading previously unpublished first books as it often turns out they should have stayed unpublished. That is not the case with this book. It offered an interesting twist for the female main character, and she was a character I could love. She was tough without being bombastic, and was kind and empathetic. The mystery was well crafted, and had an ending that I didn't see coming. I really hope that the author decides to continue the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 12, 2024
reviews.reviewText: I am not much into paranormal fiction these days but because I enjoy Joy Ellis' writing and her crime fiction so much, I decided I had to at least give this new book a shot. And I am SO happy that I did! Ms. Ellis does an excellent job of marrying paranormal and crime fiction and truly delivered in this book. I am once again totally convinced that Ms. Ellis has a genius for writing books that you find it hard to put down until it is finished. Brilliant!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 7, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent, just excellent!
reviews.reviewText: This is not my usual genre, but because it was Joy Ellis’ first book I thought I would try it. WOW am I glad I did! It is awesome. As I neared the end I thought it would be a standalone story. I am having a hard time finding the words to express how excited I was to read the introduction to the Ellie McEwan mystery, I can’t wait to read it. I hope you enjoy reading these books as much as I did.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 24, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 3.0 out of 5 stars Not bad at all
reviews.reviewText: It was interesting to read her early writing. It was a bit wordy by comparison. Her writing has gotten cleaner but I liked the characters and the story. It was also fun to see the seeds for who would become major characters in her later books.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 14, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Marvelous First Novel!
reviews.reviewText: Joy Ellis’ first novel was hidden away in her attic. It is such a great read, I am very glad it has finally been published.I tend to shy away from fiction that contain anything supernatural or simply unbelievable, but An Aura of Mystery made it clear that well-written fiction can grab my attention and keep my interest throughout the read.I highly recommend this book.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Really Good Read
reviews.reviewText: I am glad you resurrected this work and let it out into the world for all of us to enjoy. Thank you. I did thoroughly enjoy reading this volume, although I read it too quickly, because I had to get to the conclusion. I couldn’t wait. Hope you have a few more like this one tucked away.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewText: My initial thoughts upon starting this book are that it’s absolutely amazing. It is a deeply mystical and somewhat magical story. The amount of research that this author has undertaken to dig deep into the world of reading the auras that people supposedly exude is admirable. This is something that I have heard about before, and it is certainly extremely interesting. Although there is no apparent scientific evidence that these auras exist, there certainly seems to be quite a number of people who have the ability to read them. Joy Ellis has clearly taken the immensely exciting decision to immerse herself in this idea and has created a delightful and exciting story around it. The book itself is cleverly written and is indeed an absolute joy to read. The mixture of the apparent supernatural abilities of a young woman in her quest to assist the police in an urgent hunt for a psychotic killer, make a perfectly intense and compelling read. The ending is just fantastic although desperately sad – well it certainly made me cry. I am now wanting more of this exciting world I have been introduced to and I’m looking forward to the next in the series which I have already ordered. The wonderful thing about this book is that it was written 20 years ago and never published before, which I find hard to understand. Thankfully Joy’s current publishers had every faith in this novel, even though it was so different to her normal stories. It has proved to me, more than ever, that Joy is one of the best authors around and I simply love reading her books.

Oh my goodness, what an absolutely fabulous book. I was gripped right from the start. So interesting to read all about » auras » and then tie it all in with murder mystery. Hopefully there will be more books like this to come. A must, and a real page turner.

I have just finished Joy Ellis’s recently published An Aura of Mystery. It has been gathering dust in Joy’s attic for the last 20 years. It is the first book she ever wrote. Ellie was involved in a car accident late one night and on recovery she has a special gift, the gift of auric sight. She stays with a very dear friend, Carole, for her recovery and is helped along in this regard by some other people she eventually holds very close. Murders of young women are being carried out by a serial killer and Ellie’s help is enlisted by the police. I would never have believed it was Joy’s first book. It is very well written, unpredictable, clever and grabs your attention. It is very hard to put down. I look forward to the next book. Unfortunately there will only be the 2 books in the series.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on February 2, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This first novel lay in Joy's attic, unpublished for many years despite her many successes since then in the police procedural genre. It's so clear from reading this book that writing was deep in her soul well before she began in earnest. Of course, since then, Joy has become a bit of a legend but it was lovely to read this first attempt which I thoroughly enjoyed. It's really two stories which eventually merge - which makes it quite a long read compare to her other books - but both stories are so well written and weave together wonderfully towards the end when I could hardly put it down. As always in Joy's books, the characters (apart from the baddies obviously) are really lovely people and this is something that makes for a very cosy feel to the stories even when they are dealing with gruesome subjects. I look forward to starting the next in the series and hope that Joy will consider writing more as I'm keen to read how Ellie continues to use her gift as she learns to master it.
Oh Joy I absolutely loved this. What a wonderful change to read something that is so different. I just could not put it down. My family only got grunts and humms out of me. Just started the next.
